description.title: Save It
description.description: Find and collect possible hazards to prevent the environmental damage!

participant.lostText: You have unfortunately not found a dangerous object for too long, which has now caused a damage. You have lost, please try again.
participant.winText: You managed to save the environment from the hazardous objects!

tutorial.placing:
Click on any spot in the scene to get a list of placeable objects and choose one of those objects to place it.
Move the object by drag and drop and rotate, scale and delete the selected object by using the toolbar button.
tutorial.finding:
This scene is not as harmless as it might seem!
Scattered throughout these scene are dangerous hazards. Collect them by clicking on them and prevent a massive disaster before it is too late!
Use the magnifying glass to look behind trees and other view obstructing objects.

participant.collectable: very good, this object was searched for
participant.not-collectable: this object does not belong here, but is not wanted in this case

cigarette.name: Cigarette
cigarette.description: Cigarettes which haven't been extinguished properly are one of the most severe fire hazards out there. They get thrown out of cars or get left behind by hikers on their way to the top.

campfire.name: Campfire
campfire.description: Campfires can be rekindled by the wind, causing a forest fire.

dead-tree.name: dead Tree
dead-tree.description: Dead trees can dry out, which increases the risk of them catching fire.

turtle.name: Turtles
turtle.description: Turtles do not occur naturally in our area. Exposed in the forest, they are defenseless.

bug.name: Bugs
bug.description: Beetles are part of the natural ecosystem, form the basis of the food chain for other animals and loosen the soil. Their survival is therefore important for the survival of the forest and other animals.

bottle.name: Glass Bottle
bottle.description: It is a myth that left-behind glass bottles of all kinds act like a lens under the right circumstances and focus the light. No one can start a fire at the focal point! However, garbage does not belong in the forest, as animals can get hurt.

fish.name: Fish
fish.description: Fishes can be stranded after the flood and need to be rescued.

sandbag.name: Sandbag
sandbag.description: Sandbags have to be removed after the flood is over, as they are blocking paths and streets.

garbage.name: Garbage
garbage.description: Garbage can be carried away by the flood and must be collected again later in order to not pollute the environment.

branches.name: Branches
branches.description: Branches and Driftwood can be washed into the streets and have to be cleaned up.

bottle.name: Glass Bottle
bottle.description: It is a myth that left-behind glass bottles of all kinds act like a lens under the right circumstances and focus the light. No one can start a fire at the focal point! However, garbage does not belong in the forest, as animals can get hurt.
